meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6502.

td.p: Joe Emison, a chief technology officer from Asheville, North Carolina
Kevin Moser, an attorney from Fort Wright, Kentucky
Susan Jann, an operations coordinator from Bristol, Pennsylvania (whose 1-day cash winnings total $22,800)

tr.td: SOCK IT TO ME
SPORTS TERMS
TENNESSEE'S WILLIAMS
"BLOCK" PARTY
EAT PREY
LOVE

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This term for a teenage girl of the 1940s refers to ankle socks folded over at the top')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This term for a teenage girl of the 1940s refers to ankle socks folded over at the top

the U.S. Senate

SusanKevinJoe
Triple Stumper
')

This basic swimming stroke used by lifesavers was pioneered in Australia during a rescue approach. It\'s modified to keep the head out of the water and the rescuer\'s eyes on the victim')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Susan
Kevin
Joe
THE 12th CENTURY
GRAMMAR
THE P-51 MUSTANG
ARCHITECTURE
(In honor of his centennial year...)
WOODY GUTHRIE
THIS ISLAND IS YOUR ISLAND
(We'll give you the island; you tell us the country it belongs to.)

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
